TopicTitle: Can't use the Whack A Kerbal feature.

Articles.Content:
Hello,

As most of you know, the whack a kerbal feature has been added to the cheat menu in 2.0,

Only problem is, I can't fire objects with it. I can open the sub menu fine but when i press MMB nothing happened. I looked further into this and found that the MMB on my mouse is somehow linked to the left control button when I tried to bind MMB to another key. This only happens in KSP though, on my browser or my desktop it works normally. Any information about how to fix this problem will be greatly appreciated. Thanks in

advance.
Try to change in your drivers "Mouse wheel button" to "Default" or something like that.
took me a while to figure out that i had the cursor of to the side when i clicked the mousewheel. brought the cursor to the middle and worked fine. silly me...
care to give us a bit more info? are you on PC, Mac, or Linux?
What the heck is the cheat menu? Whack a Kerbal sounds interesting....
That doesn't work unfortunately, The MMB acts as the LControl does. So, if I press the MMB when my throttle is up it will go down.
I somehow believe this is the problem. Can you explain how to do this?
Use the Middle Mouse Button to fire the object
because i have a trackball mouse that does not have a mmb i use something called auto hotkey (its a program) that lets you rebind any key to any other key hope this helps

click MMB or middle mouse button and mac FN-ALT-F12 for menu win ALT-F12

Edited March 13, 2017 by JakGamingKSP
forgot some stuff

Things have changed a lot in the four years since @LostAlot asked the question, so I'd better lock the thread in case any out-of-date information starts spreading around. Thanks for helping though, hope you can answer some more recent questions for other people too!
